summary: Singapore-based fintech startup BoltPay has successfully closed a $25 million Series B round led by Sequoia Capital. The funds will be used to expand its payment gateway services into Vietnam and the Philippines.
heading: BoltPay Secures $25M in Series B to Fuel Southeast Asia Expansion

summary: The UAE Central Bank has announced new regulatory frameworks for digital payment providers, aiming to enhance security and foster innovation. The new rules will take effect starting January 2026.
heading: UAE Central Bank Issues New Regulatory Framework for Digital Payments

summary: Indonesian super-app giant GoTo has officially launched its merchant financing program, offering small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) access to working capital loans directly through their merchant app.
heading: GoTo Launches SME Financing Program for Merchants in Indonesia

summary: Saudi Arabian payments firm 'Madfooat' has acquired competitor 'HalalaH' in a landmark deal valued at approximately $150 million, consolidating its position as the leading payment processor in the Kingdom.
heading: Madfooat Acquires HalalaH in a $150M Deal to Dominate Saudi Payments Market

summary: PayMaya, a leading digital wallet in the Philippines, is rebranding to 'Maya' and expanding its services to include cryptocurrency trading and a digital banking experience under its new license.
heading: PayMaya Rebrands to 'Maya', Expands into Crypto and Digital Banking

summary: Stripe has announced a strategic partnership with Japan's JCB to allow millions of merchants on the Stripe network to seamlessly accept payments from JCB cardholders worldwide.
heading: Stripe Partners with JCB to Expand Payment Acceptance for Merchants

summary: Dubai-based e-commerce platform Noon.com reported a 45% increase in online payment transactions during the first half of the year, signaling a strong shift away from cash-on-delivery.
heading: Noon.com Sees 45% Surge in Digital Payments, Indicating Shift from Cash

summary: Riyadh-based payments startup 'CashFlow' has announced a strategic partnership with e-commerce giant Amazon to become a preferred payment processor for Amazon.sa, simplifying checkout for millions of customers.
heading: CashFlow Partners with Amazon to Power Payments in Saudi Arabia

summary: Cairo's 'PayFast Egypt' has secured a $5 million seed round from local and international investors. The company aims to build a comprehensive payment ecosystem for underserved merchants in the region.
heading: Egyptian Fintech PayFast Egypt Raises $5M in Seed Funding

summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has granted a new digital banking license to the consortium led by Ant Group, paving the way for the launch of a new digital bank in early 2026.
heading: MAS Grants Digital Banking License to Ant Group Consortium in Singapore

summary: Indian payments leader Razorpay has launched 'MandiPay,' a new platform tailored for the agricultural sector, enabling digital payments for farmers and traders at wholesale markets (mandis).
heading: Razorpay Launches 'MandiPay' to Digitize India's Agricultural Supply Chain

summary: Visa announced the appointment of a new Regional Manager for its MENA operations. Ali Hammoud will now lead the company's strategy to deepen digital payment penetration across the Middle East and North Africa.
heading: Visa Appoints Ali Hammoud as New Regional Manager for MENA

summary: Malaysian fintech 'SenangPay' is expanding its operations to Indonesia, aiming to capture a share of the rapidly growing e-commerce market by offering localized payment solutions for online businesses.
heading: Malaysia's SenangPay Expands into Indonesian E-commerce Market

summary: A new report by Checkout.com reveals that the KSA e-commerce market is projected to reach $20 billion by 2027, driven by high internet penetration and a young, digitally-savvy population.
heading: Saudi E-commerce Market to Hit $20 Billion by 2027, says Report

summary: Global payments giant Adyen is deepening its presence in the Middle East by opening a new office in Dubai, which will serve as its regional hub for business development and operations.
heading: Adyen Opens Dubai Office to Serve as Middle East Hub
